text: A thought experiment on racial slurs I wondered this morning why certain people are allowed to say racial or sexist insults  for example black people saying the n word  and males saying  Oh us men are just dumb haha  I m sure it s fine in most cases  since it seems to be socially acceptable  and it s not gonna change anytime soon   But  I thought  would there be a way to make it seem wrong to say such things  This is what I came up with So  the n word is a slur against all black people yes  So that would mean that if a black man were to use said word  he d be insulting every gender within that race  besides males  since he is a male  Which means that a black man saying the n word could be considered him attacking all black women  bisexuals  homosexuals  etc  meaning that the word is both sexist and homophobic Same thing with sexist remarks  If a white man says  Ahaha  sorry  us men are dumb  apologetically after a mistake  then every single race besides white people would individually drop a tactical thermonuclear warhead on his location I laughed when I thought of that haha  hope someone else finds it funny
summary: A thought experiment on racial and sexist insults suggests that the n-word is a slur against all black people and a sexist insult against all men is both sexist and homophobic. If a white man apologizes for his mistake, every single race would drop a thermonuclear warhead on his location.
cleaned: thought experiment racial sexist insult suggest word slur black people sexist insult man sexist homophobic white man apologize mistake single race drop thermonuclear warhead location

text: A caring trans girl that s been beaten down one too many times I never thought i would have come to this point   I pass except for my voice  I still smoke cigarettes   Daily  people make a conscious effort to remind me that I m less human than them  People that walk by me take the time to look me directly in the eyes  I ve never felt so much deep seated hatred  Some even verbalize they see garbage  I m not welcome  I should be at home and not challenge people by existing   I ve spent   years of hard work  therapy  building a career  losing all of my friends when I started physically changing on hormones  but I made a few new people that could understand  It s not an identity to me  I have a genetic hormone disorder  That I hoped i could save the money to so  so I can heal and be the brightest light i can S
summary: Transgender girl has been beaten down one too many times. She lost all her friends when she started physically changing on hormones. She has a genetic hormone disorder. She hopes to save the money to go to a private clinic to treat it.
